instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 no power after changing palmrest
threads.message:
have i killed the PCH on this board? it had a bloated battery and the battery has been disconnected. i can power on with MagSafe 2 85w fine . so i took the board out then put in a good chassis with good battery. now it doesn't power up at all with battery nor charger.

PP1v05_PCH_VCCIO_S0 has 14 ohms to ground.

on a known good board it has 33 ohms to ground on PP1v05_PCH_VCCIO_S0
8

ppbus_g3h 12.57
PP3v42 - 3.4v
smc_bk_ACOK 3.3v
the resistance between 17/18 : 4.4 ohms and 27/28 22ohms
smc_lid 3.4v
no pm_slp_s4_l
no pp3v3_sus

threads.title: 820-3332 no power after changing palmrest
threads.message: Definitely using 85 watt magsafe 2 OEM? If in doubt, check PM_BATLOW_L

threads.title: 820-3332 no power after changing palmrest
threads.message: yes. i need a signature. i only used genuine lol

threads.title: 820-3332 no power after changing palmrest
threads.message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 54848"]Do you get PP5v_S5/PP3v3_S5? [/QUOTE]

yep

PP5v_S5  5v
PP3v3_S5 3.3

threads.title: 820-3332 no power after changing palmrest
threads.message:
I've spent over an hour working on this board last night.

just then..I've tried plugging a MagSafe in this morning.
now it does fan spin
why?

threads.title: 820-3332 no power after changing palmrest
threads.message: Sounds like you were trolled by bad charger or just a weird intermittent thing.

threads.title: 820-3332 no power after changing palmrest
threads.message: na i've two chargers on the desk. they work fine on similar board. i always like to compare measurements. you are right just a weird intermittent thing.
